habitat_description:
In Arizona, this treefrog is found 17.7Km south below Springerville in Apache County (Taylor 1938); in grassy areas of the Madrean Evergreen Woodland and Petran Montane Conifer Forest (Brennan and Holycross 2009), populations occur in forested uplands along Williams and into west central New Mexico (Degenhardt et al. 1996; Stebbins 1985). Disjoint populations occur in the Huachuca Mountains, the Sierra Anchas Mountains, and Canelo Hills. In Mexico this species occurs in the Sierra Madre Occidental south into Michoacan (Lannoo 2005). 

Breeding is preferred in areas where rainwater collects, but also takes place in permanent bodies of water even those lacking vegetation (i.e. cattle tanks) (Lannoo 2005). Habitats also include meadows (Stebbins 1985).
